content: works great for my matricom G2 box

The app itself is ok but even with an high end gaming rig the server hammers your cpu at 100% I've got 8 fans and liquid cooling and still hits between 65 to 70 degrees ! I was going to get the pro version and get rid of my Plex but until that problem is fixed there's no chance ! I'm running Windows 10 64bit
replyContent: Possibly Mezzmo is transcoding a file on the PC.  Try changing the profile for the Android device to Conceiva Mezzmo (Android) to see if the file plays without transcoding.

content: Avi not playing since update only sound ,and constantly crashing ,updated ,now previously encoded media stops after 10 seconds of play ....live by this moto if it ain't broke why fix it !!
replyContent: The internal video player in the app was changed to use a different library so that we could support 64 bit version devices.  If you have problems playing videos you can disable the internal video player in settings and use an external video player app.

content: Don't like the new gui, bring back the old one.
replyContent: The gui has not changed for a few years, if there is a particular part of the user interface you do not like please send an email to support@conceiva.com to tell us more about it.

content: Hi Team. Using the app for a long time and loving it but would love one feature. If I have, let's say, folders from A to Z and I enter for X for example, but then decide I don't want to watch anything in it so I press 'back', the highlighted folder goes all the way back to A. Can this behavior be changed so that pressing 'back' takes you back but keeps the last selected folder? Thanks again.
replyContent: Hi, there is a list view in the app which you can activate by selecting the view icon in the top right of the app to cycle through the view modes.

content: I love how this has everything you need. As a player it just plays well and I have 0 issue so far.
Started crashing recently when playing video files. Nothing seems to work
replyContent: This could be a problem with Android 10, please send an email to support@conceiva.com and we will give you access to an update to fix the issue.

content: Sucks. Roku won't detect android server
replyContent: Hi, we are sorry for the issue you have experienced.  Are both the Roku and the Mezzmo app in the same local network where the first three groups of numbers in the IP address have the same value?

content: seems to do all the right things, but for the life of me I can't get it to update the media library. I can delete a music folder but it continues to be displayed !!. Got to knock a point off unless there is some way to do update
replyContent: The app uses the Android media storage database so the folder may not be updated until the device is restarted and the android system updates the database.

content: The Best
Plays many files without issue.

One of the best app for DLNA for android. Works everything 100%.   Two additional improvements for mezzmo team:  * I am missing audio boost function, like VLC player has. Volume to 200%  Some movies has AC3 or DTS very quiet. Is there any option to implement these boost function in your future update of android app.  * In app library that it will work with android TV (TV remote control). Menus work, but library needs a USB mouse.  Best regards
Great portable media server or DLNA client, works flawlessly with the Media server on PC as well.
Great DLNA streamer.  Weird like it is supposed to.
replyContent: Glad to hear it's working.

content: I am using this app together with Mezzmo media server to stream our media (stills and video) on our home network.  Both are easy to set up and very reliable. I tried many DLNA apps and none beats this product. Plus there is really great support if a small problem comes up.

It's very close to perfect, I use mezzmo servo on my pc as well, the two work very well together.  My only complaint would be that I'll occasionally encounter an mkv file that will play with no audio when I stream to a chromecast.
replyContent: The chromecast may not support AC3 audio so if you have an mkv file with AC3 audio this might explain why it does not play.  We can provide an updated device profile for the Mezzmo server on your PC that will transcode the audio to aac, please contact support@conceiva.com to get this profile.

content: Great software for controlling media and casting to DLNA streaming devices. When it is paired with Mezzmo Server it is awesome. I still can't figure out why people even consider Plex when this is available.

Runs in background constantly when not in use (starts automatically when phone is booted), crashes repeatedly even though not specifically opened.  I have to uninstall after use and reinstall to watch.  Good concept, but very unstable. (I appreciate the feedback and will re-rate the next release!)
replyContent: Sorry to hear of the problems, when not in use you should exit the app from the menu so that it does not continue to run in the background.  We will release an update with fixes for the crash reports we have received in the coming week.

content: Love the app and home server for my videos. Great customer service!
I try to listen to a Smart playlist of songs on my phone streamed from my computer running Mezzmo and it plays one or two or three songs and then stops for no reason. Very disappointing.
replyContent: We have made a change to fix this issue in devices running KitKat or later.

content: Does more than one can imagine. Tech support is fantastic. Buy this app.
Working like a charm!
replyContent: If you have both the trial and paid version installed please try uninstalling the trial version to see if this helps the paid version to see your computer.  If you still have problems please contact support@conceiva.com and we can help to resolve the issue.

content: Was really hoping this update would be the one app for my NVidia Shield TV but the built in video player is seriously lacking. It doesn't support HD audio pass through to my receiver and is not intuitive at all when it comes to subtitles and selecting audio tracks etc. There are several other issues too numerous to list in this review. Unfortunately very disappointing.
replyContent: We would like to try and improve your experience with the Mezzmo app, please contact support@conceiva.com and we can try to fix the issues you have encountered in the app.

content: Good upgrade!
I wish it would be optimized to work with Android TV.
replyContent: We are working on version 2.0 of the app which will be optimized for Android TV.

content: Been usimg it for months now and it works great. Would love to find out how to stream with subtitles?
replyContent: Streaming videos with subtitles depends upon the device or app being used to play the video.  If the video is being played on the android device then you will need to use a video player app that supports displaying subtitles.  In version 2.0 of the app which we are currently working on there is a built-in video player that supports subtitles.

content: Easy setup. Works well most of the time. Sorting my media inventory by date would really be helpful. Right now it sorts alphabetically.
nice app. sees minidlna but wont talk to my rygel server (running on debian)
replyContent: The rygel server appears to use the MediaServer:2 interface where the Mezzmo app is currently only looking for MediaServer:1 servers, we will investigate to try and get this working for version 2 of the app.

content: Works great and it has a beautiful layout, easy to use and just works like it should. Excellent
good
I just hope it's able to stay on indefinitely and not turn off involuntarily like the demo.

works well in combo with Mezzmo on my PC. when i play back a video though (any video), the position of the video is always displayed at 0:00 . it doesn't seem to move or display the position of thy video.
replyContent: The position might show as 0:00 if the video is transcoded on the fly by Mezzmo, please try pre-transcoding the file to see if this shows the position.

content: For some reason I can no longer fast forward movies and they keep stopping after a few minutes. I've tried with movies that I've watched before in its entirety. Seems like this started either after the app update or the media server update.
replyContent: Please send an email to support@conceiva.com and we can help to resolve this problem.

content: ***UPDATE - Thanks for reaching out Mezzmo!  Works as should now.  It was an error my end! Excellent program! Five Stars!!!!! _____________________________________________  Love this program.  My smart tv's and Playstations see my Mezzmo server with no issues.  However,  the app doesn't see the server. I thought this was because I still had the trial version so I got the full version. Same result.  I am unable to see my local server.  Once this is fixed this will be a 5 star app. Please fix!
replyContent:
Hi Tim,
Please contact us at support@conceiva.com and we can help to resolve this issue.

content: Great app. I needed an app that can allow my phone to host a dlna server and this one works very well. I can even host via hotspot. Love this app, a must have.
Android or PC its great.Support is second to none.

It seems very stable and works the way you would expect it to. The search is not bad even with a large data base. All and all I`m very happy with it.                                                    Update - If you can't get media to play on your device the first thing to check is the pin to lock content under the settings. Somehow a four digit pin was set not allowing me to play any content. I blanked it out and wholloa, everything plays again! I'm tickled! Great program!
replyContent: Please contact us through support [at] conceiva [dot] com and we can help to resolve the problem.

content: Very nice software. Almost faultless and improving all the time.
You have a phone capable of 5g wifi the phone server is brilliant
This application is very good, but needs social media integration, like facebook and google +
I love this app, it works seamlessly with and without the PC server. Great work guys!

On my Galaxy Note II it runs a little slow sometimes, and hardware buttons for volume don't work so it's a little fiddly to change volume with the slider. Overall great app, but please consider the following fixes: -Absolutely needs subtitle support - this is a MUST for playing movies - and the subtitles should be taken directly from the server and a toggle off/on button on the app -ALSO please provide +/1 buttons for volume instead of the slider ...........Keep up the good work team!
replyContent: Thanks for the feedback, we will investigate adding subtitle support in one of the next updates and will also look at improving the volume controls.

content: Works with wdlive but not ps3
replyContent: The ps3 is not a DMR (Digital Media Renderer) and does not implement the AVTransport interface so the Mezzmo app cannot control the ps3.

content: We use mezzmo for windows as a media server to our samsung tv's, western digital media player and wmp on our laptops and its best out there.  Now with the mezzmo for android app we stream all that content to or phones and tablets too.  As if that wasn't enough, I use my phone to push videos to my tvs now.. no more hunting for the remote :-)  LOVE it!

Company couldn't be more responsive. That's the reason for the 5 stars.  The app is first class also.  Play locally or on any network device. Cast to Chromecast. And the #1 feature for me, stream Blu-Rays. Nice smooth operation. Combine with desktop PC server and you have an awesome home media system.
Update to last review:  Version 1.01 fixed the constant crashing.  Thanks, Conceiva, for the fast fix. Definitely a 5 star companion to a wonderful Mezzmo server 4.0 now.
replyContent: We have received the crash reports you sent and have fixed the crashes, an update will be released today to resolve the problem.

content: Best streaming app. Gets better with every update

Been using mezzmo for a very long time to stream to my tv's and now finally there's an app for it and it rocks!  Now if I could just stream from my home pc to my tablet while I'm sitting in a boat in northern MN that would be awsome!  Icing on the cake!

Been using the Mezzmo media server for years. Best full featured media server out there with excellent developement and support team. Now added Android App - was part of Beta testing and it does not dissapoint.
Excellent app. Been using mezzmo for ages it's by far the best media server and this app is just as good.
